content: betty s bandana this elongated-triangle bandana is knit flat in garter stitch and shaped with yarn-over increases this scarf can be worked at any gauge and the size of your bandana is completely customizable simply work as many row as you please tools and materials i made my samples with smooth terminology and techniques multi-plied yarn in fingering and dk weights but any yarn can be used cast on - the foundation of your project estimated yardages based on yarn i recommend a basic long-tail cast on weight for a small large bandana for this project fingering weight 130 yards gabrielle has made an excellent sport/dk 210 yards video/picture tutorial for the long tail cast on - link use a 32 of 40 circular needle one size pm - place marker larger than recommended to add drape sm - slip marker to your scarf i used a size us 3 for my yo - yarn over increase - wrap yarn fingering weight sample and a size us 7 over top the right needle to create new for my dk weight sample if you make stitch a very large scarf a longer cable may bobble - bind off be required rs - right side the public-facing side of your project 2 locking stitch markers ws - wrong side darning needle to weave in ends pattern instructions cast on 5 stitches row 1 rs knit 1 yo knit 1 yo knit 1 yo knit 1 yo knit 1 +4 stitches 9 stitches total row 2 ws knit across all stitches 9 stitches row 3 rs knit 1 yo knit 1 yo knit 2 yo pm knit 1 yo knit 2 yo knit 1 yo knit 1 +6 stitches 15 stitches total one marker placed row 4 ws knit across all stitches slipping the marker as you reach it from this point until you bind off you will be working a simple two-row repeat increase by 6 stitches on the right side of the work and knit across all stitches on the wrong side tip as you work the next rs row place a locking stitch marker on the front of your work to help differentiate between the rs and ws in your reversible garter stitch rs knit 1 yo knit 1 yo knit until marker yo sm knit 1 yo knit until 2 stitches remain yo k1 yo k1 ws knit repeat until you have reached your desired scarf dimensions ending after a ws row you will need to maintain a length of yarn approximately five times the width of your bandana to bind off i used a simple bind off instructions are provided below ensure you knit your bind off loosely to bind off knit 2 stitches pass the first stitch you made over the second stitch and off of your right-hand needle you have bound off one stitch repeat until you have bound off all stitches cut your yarn leaving approximately a 4 tail and pull the tail through the
